text:
Raskolnikov left the room, feeling more sure of himself. He thought, “Now everything is even.” As he walked down the stairs, he smiled in a mean way and said, “Now we’ll fight back.” His anger was really directed at himself because he felt ashamed and looked down on his own fear.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov leaves the room feeling more confident, despite his internal shame and contempt for his own cowardice.
